discussion.content: Skype for Business admin center is no longer avaiable

This is how I want to approach the question Set-CsCallinglineidentity or New-CsCallinglineidentity for MS teams powershell, so A.
Rule out other options, Azure, CQD, Windows powershell has nothing to do with it. 
I will take what's left.

comments.content: Good way approach the question like.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
Same as topic 5, Q21
That would be pretty dumb for them to ask this question still. SfBO is long gone now

I wonder if they still ask this question. The SFB Admin Center and and the SFB PowerShell module are obsolete. The SFB Powershell module is included in the Teams Powershell nowadays, you don't need to install or load it separately anymore.

comments.content: Yes, they still ask it like this. Seen it today in my exam.

discussion.content:
I would say AD.

SfBO Powershell module to create the the CallingLinePolicy with New-CsCallingLineIdentity. This command does not appear in the Teams PS module and there is no answer that includes Teams admin center.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/skype/new-cscallinglineidentity?view=skype-ps

Then batch assign the new identity to all 50 IT team members with the Teams PS Module - New-CsBatchPolicyAssignmentOperation. It explicitely lists that CallingLineIdentity as available policy to assign.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/powershell/module/teams/new-csbatchpolicyassignmentoperation?view=teams-ps

questions.question_text:
Your company has a Microsoft 365 subscription. The subscription contains 200 Microsoft Teams users and a team named IT Support that has 50 members.
You need to ensure that the caller ID for outbound PSTN calls from IT Support is the phone number of the company's IT helpdesk. The solution must minimize administrative effort.
Which two tools should you include in the solution? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.B: the Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) PowerShell for Graph module
choices.E: the Skype for Business admin center
choices.D: the Windows PowerShell module for Microsoft Skype for Business Online

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription that contains a user named User1.
You need to change the default conferencing toll phone number for User1 by using the Microsoft Teams admin center.
What should you modify for User1?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
TAC--> Users --> Manage Users --> Audio Conference --> Default Conference toll-free phone number

Selected Answer: A
Agreed

this one looks correct:
"In the Audio Conferencing pane, you can set the Toll number and, if allowed, the Toll-free number."

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoftteams/manage-the-audio-conferencing-settings-for-my-organization-in-teams#set-the-phone-numbers-included-on-invites

comments.content: also Auto Attendants, allows you to play a greeting message for incoming calls and route them based on various options, including playing on-hold music and forwarding calls to external phone numbers. It covers both the greeting and on-hold music needs.
sorry i meant calling policy here.

Auto Attendants allow you to set up a greeting message and configure call handling options, including call forwarding. You can define the behavior of calls, including forwarding and ringing settings.
Calling Policies control the calling features and behavior for users. Within the Calling Policies, you can configure settings related to simultaneous ringing to external phone numbers. This setting is usually controlled in the "Simultaneous Ringing" or similar section of the Calling Policy.....
Fully agree since AA do not have music-on-hold....

discussion.content: 100% -- Call Queues and Call Policies
Old question I'm sure. Now we have Call Hold policies where you can specify the Music on Hold when a Teams user put a call on hold, but it's not in this list.
Calling policy --> Call forwarding and simultaneous ringing to external phone numbers
Should be CQ and Calling Policies
AA doesn't has music on hold
Call queues can do music on hold and greeting too
Call Queue should definitely be one of the answers

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
You have a Microsoft 365 E5 subscription.
You plan to enable Phone System for Microsoft Teams.
You need to configure the following:
✑ On-hold music
✑ A greeting message
✑ Call forwarding and simultaneous ringing to external phone numbers
Which two settings should you configure? To answer, select the appropriate settings in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point
Hot Area:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Technically you cannot assign number directly to call queue. You have to assign number to resource account and then add resource account to the call queue.
On Exam 28.02.22
Correct

choices.C: From Policies, modify the voice routing policy.
choices.B: From Voice, add User1 to group call pickup.
choices.A: From Voice, add User2 to group call pickup.
choices.E: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the settings of User1.
choices.D: From the Microsoft Teams admin center, modify the settings of User2.

discussion.content: Think of this as doing E then A

Nowadays only change of settings of User1 is required in Teams Admin Center. Configure within menu "Voice" that a call is immediately is being forward to User 2. While specifying the "Call forward type" to "Forward to a person", you can choose "Group call pickup" as well. However, a Group call pickup is ot required.
Why wouldn't you just set the voice call settings for user1 to forward to user2? Why create a group?

A we are perfectly agree, we need to be sure that User2 is memeber of the group of User1.
But for the rest I don't know Because, Yes you can modify User1 ... But in anycase, he is not available so Routing we don't car, it's not gonna call User1. End he comes back after 2 weeks ... So I don't really see the gain there?
I Agree with the answer

questions.question_text:
You have a Microsoft 365 subscription that contains two users named User1 and User2. The users are provisioned for Microsoft Teams calling.
User1 is on leave for two weeks.
You need to ensure that User2 is notified of all calls to User1 while User1 is away.
Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
